milestones.title: M2 — Safety & Validation Hardening
milestones.description: Strengthen patch safety, validation guarantees, and deterministic behavior.

issues.title: [Safety] Patch application lacks page-level content binding
issues.body:
## Problem

The current patch application process does not enforce a binding between a patch and the exact page content it was derived from. This means a patch may still apply even if the underlying page has changed in subtle but meaningful ways.

## Why this matters

Without page-level content binding:

- Patches may apply to stale or mutated documents
- Validation may succeed while semantic intent is violated
- Deterministic replay of patches cannot be guaranteed

This weakens the safety guarantees of the engine.

## Proposed direction

Introduce an **optional page-level hash binding** that:

- Computes a stable hash of the normalized source content
- Embeds this hash into the patch metadata
- Rejects patch application when the hash does not match

The mechanism must be:

- Deterministic
- Explicitly opt-in
- Compatible with future patch versions

## Acceptance criteria

- [ ] Page-level content hash can be generated deterministically
- [ ] Patch metadata can optionally include the hash
- [ ] Patch application fails fast on hash mismatch
- [ ] Failure mode produces a clear diagnostic
- [ ] No behavior change when feature is disabled

## Notes

This is a safety hardening measure and should be treated as a high-priority fix.
